meaningMnemonic: When what you're writing is as <radical>tall</radical> as the <radical>grain</radical>s growing outside, you know you're done with your first <kanji>draft</kanji>. Some teachers want papers to be a certain number of words or pages, but that's silly. You should measure your draft in grains!
readingMnemonic: Who asked you to write such a tall <kanji>draft</kanji> in the first place? Emperor <reading>こう</reading>いち, who wants you to draft up the world's largest book about how great of an emperor he is.
